Class ec.e.rep.KnownDataHolder 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.rep.KnownDataHolder
public class KnownDataHolder
extends Object
implements DataHolder
KnownDataHolder - An object that is a placeholder for some large data object and can be asked to return a reference to it. KnownDataHolder holds on to objects that are "known" to be locally available, typically in the Repository. KnownDataHolder implements the DataHolder interface.

The myDataLeaf is known to be a non-null Tether. DataHolders are STEWARDS. Their myDataLeaf tethers point to out-of-vat constant data that we don't want to include in a persistence checkpoint file and which can be retreieved at will from the Repository and/or the network (WWWeb or EC-Realm-Hosts). They also hold a CREWspace mutable static (for now) reference to the main fulfiller.

KnownDataHolder(Vat, Object)
KnownDataHolder(Vat, Object, CryptoHash)

giveDataTo 
  public void giveDataTo(DataRequestor requestor)
Request the data using the asynchronous interface. Since a KnownDataHolder either has the data or will be unable to provide it later, it will immediately call back on the asynchronous success callback with the data, or will immediately call back on the asynchronous failure callback if it does not have it.
